Selected Answer: C
The model is compared against the data in the Hardware Normalization Content Service. Match criteria is based on Manufacturer, model Name, and Model number. The model is fully Normalized if the information is available.

On the Normalized tab:
 • The Normalized manufacturer, Product, and Model fields are set to the normalized values
 • The Normalization status is set to Normalized (i.e., fully normalized)
 • The Device type is set to a standard grouping based on the UNSPSC values
 • The Display name is set to the combined values for Normalized manufacturer + Product + Model

questions.question_text: Once the content update adds hardware lifecycle data to your instance, can it be deleted?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
HAM ServiceNow Course - Hardware Model Normalization: 
Note 2: If a content update adds lifecycle data, it cannot be deleted from the hardware/ consumable model, but you can deactivate it. Any lifecycle data that is added as part of a content update will have the source set to ‘ServiceNow’. The HAM - Apply latest content changes scheduled job runs and processes the content updates.

Selected Answer: C
